channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-8911] Inject MTTR specific traces to get a break up of various steps
item.description: There are various steps involved in a regionserver recovery process. This jira adds instrumentation at various places in order to get an idea what are the steps involved in a regionserver recovery and how much time is spent in each of these parts.
item.summary: Inject MTTR specific traces to get a break up of various steps

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
This patch does the following:
a) Adds trace support in regionserver so that it can also log traces using HBaseLocalFileSpanReceiver.
b) Adds tracing at SSH, MetaSSH, SLM classes to get an idea of break up of time spent in a regionserver failover mechanism.

Using a patched version, I kill a meta regionserver (that also had one non-meta region):
The master provides dump:


1) {"Description":"SplitLogManager","Start":1373415141061,"Annotations":{},"TraceID":7794030922126752097,"ParentID":-4469867469428889343,"Stop":1373415145255,"SpanID":-948196168508937537}



2) {"Description":"MetaServerShutdownHandler","Start":1373415141027,"Annotations":{},"TraceID":7794030922126752097,"ParentID":477902,"Stop":1373415145379,"SpanID":-4469867469428889343}



3) {"Description":"SplitLogManager","Start":1373415146016,"Annotations":{},"TraceID":3471834208649164937,"ParentID":7097670840195911759,"Stop":1373415150138,"SpanID":-8986584144293319916}



4) {"Description":"ServerShutdownHandler: AssignmentManager","Start":1373415150138,"Annotations":{},"TraceID":3471834208649164937,"ParentID":7097670840195911759,"Stop":1373415150181,"SpanID":5233034729044488427}



5) {"Description":"ServerShutdownHandler","Start":1373415145380,"Annotations":{},"TraceID":3471834208649164937,"ParentID":477902,"Stop":1373415150181,"SpanID":7097670840195911759}

Explanation:

At first, meta region is handled. Line 1) is about Log splitting of the meta logs. Line 2) is the processing time of MetaSSH (see its start/stop time covers the log splitting span at line 1).

Lines 3, 4 and 5 are about processing non-meta logs and assigning regions on the dead regionserver. Line 3 is about splitting, line 4 is about region assignment, and line 5 is the parent of 3 and 4.

On the regionserver where the new meta lands, I get the following trace:


1) {"Description":"handling callId: 28 service: AdminService methodName: openRegion size: 67.0 connection: 10.20.188.114:49125","Start":1373415145297,"Annotations":{},"TraceID":7794030922126752097,"ParentID":-4469867469428889343,"Stop":1373415145380,"SpanID":-2912335450699571517}



2) {"Description":"handling callId: 29 service: ClientService methodName: scan size: 71.0 connection: 10.20.188.114:49126","Start":1373415145865,"Annotations":{},"TraceID":3471834208649164937,"ParentID":7097670840195911759,"Stop":1373415145866,"SpanID":-1834828785626104167}



3) {"Description":"RS_OPEN_META-a1215:40020-0","Start":1373415145376,"Annotations":{},"TraceID":7794030922126752097,"ParentID":-2912335450699571517,"Stop":1373415145872,"SpanID":522405091715978575}



4) {"Description":"handling callId: 30 service: ClientService methodName: scan size: 71.0 connection: 10.20.188.114:49126","Start":1373415145977,"Annotations":{},"TraceID":3471834208649164937,"ParentID":7097670840195911759,"Stop":1373415145999,"SpanID":-3636631271530731407}



5) {"Description":"handling callId: 31 service: ClientService methodName: scan size: 50.0 connection: 10.20.188.114:49126","Start":1373415146000,"Annotations":{},"TraceID":3471834208649164937,"ParentID":7097670840195911759,"Stop":1373415146005,"SpanID":2496204017007798885}



6) {"Description":"handling callId: 32 service: ClientService methodName: scan size: 48.0 connection: 10.20.188.114:49126","Start":1373415146009,"Annotations":{},"TraceID":3471834208649164937,"ParentID":7097670840195911759,"Stop":1373415146010,"SpanID":5149809990225735159}



7) {"Description":"handling callId: 33 service: AdminService methodName: openRegion size: 66.0 connection: 10.20.188.114:49125","Start":1373415150162,"Annotations":{},"TraceID":3471834208649164937,"ParentID":5233034729044488427,"Stop":1373415150183,"SpanID":-642245433468525490}

Explanation:

Lines 1 and 3 are about opening the meta region, while other lines are about handling other regions (scaning the meta and assigning the non-meta region).

Most importantly, we could figure out the total time taken by the regionserver failover by looking at the HMaster trace file.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12591568/8911-v0.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6288//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6288//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-prefix-tree.html

Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6288//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-examples.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6288//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop-compat.html

This message is automatically generated.
Very nice. So is there a tool that I can use to visually see what's going on.

So is there a tool that I can use to visually see what's going on.

Not yet, though if you do enough work grpahviz can me made to work. HTrace github has that script.

+    Span logSplitSpan = Trace.startSpan(getClass().getSimpleName(), Sampler.ALWAYS);

Always tracing every log splitting seems like it's unnecessary. Should we make internal tracing configurable so that a bunch of spans and traces aren't created if there's no SpanReceiver registered ?


+    if (logSplitSpan != null) logSplitSpan.stop();

Can this be left around if there's an error thrown ?


+      Span amSpan = Trace.startSpan(getClass().getSimpleName() + " - Assignment Manager",

+        Sampler.ALWAYS);

This feels like it should be in assignment manager rather than in the class using assignment manager.


+    // htracing stuff.

+    spanReceiverHost = new SpanReceiverHost(getConfiguration());

+    spanReceiverHost.loadSpanReceivers();

Better comment please. A lot more comments would be really helpful.

Thanks for the reviews.

Should we make internal tracing configurable so that a bunch of spans and traces aren't created if there's no SpanReceiver registered ?

Yes, that could be done in the htrace library itself.

Can this be left around if there's an error thrown ?

If that happens, that would be a bug in the htrace library. Let me take a look.

This feels like it should be in assignment manager rather than in the class using assignment manager.

Yeah, I agree. But the reason I tied it in the SSH is because I was interested in the call made from SSH (mttr specific use case); the method to assign regions is invoked from other places too, and that would have interfered with the mttr traces. Let me know if you think otherwise.

Okay, I will add more comments

Yes, that could be done in the htrace library itself.

https://github.com/cloudera/htrace/blob/master/src/main/java/org/cloudera/htrace/impl/TrueIfTracingSampler.java

If that happens, that would be a bug in the htrace library. Let me take a look.

Nope that's expected. Since HTrace puts stuff in thread locals you'll leak them/leave them around if you don't stop them in a finally block.
https://github.com/cloudera/htrace/blob/master/src/main/java/org/cloudera/htrace/Tracer.java

Changes as per Elliott's review.

Threadlocal stuff.

Hmm, somehow I thought you meant what if some error is thrown in Span.stop() method itself.
